entry.title: The Alconbury Airfield (Rail Facilities and Connection to East Coast Main Line) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order authorises Alconbury Developments Limited to construct works to provide rail freight facilities at Alconbury Airfield, in the District of Huntingdonshire, in the County of Cambridgeshire, including railway sidings within the Airfield, bridges and railway connections to the East Coast Main Line for use in relation to an industrial warehousing and distribution development. The Order includes compulsory powers for the acquisition of land and rights in land for the purpose of the authorised works.

entry.title: The Civil Procedure (Amendment No. 5) Rules 2003

ukm:Subject.Value: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: SUPREME COURT OF ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Rules make amendments to the Civil Procedure Rules 1998 and to the RSC and CCR Rules in Schedules 1 and 2 to those Rules. In particular the following new provisions are inserted:

entry.title: The Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 (Amendment of section 46(1) and paragraph 7(2) of Schedule 8) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order adds to the list of organisations set out in section 46(1) of the Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 (“the 2002 Act”) which the Chief Inspector of Criminal Justice in Northern Ireland is under a duty to inspect. The organisations listed have responsibility for harbours and airport police. Section 46(1) was amended by the Justice (Northern Ireland) Act 2002 (Amendment of section 46(1)) Order 2002 (S.R. 2002/414). This Order also adds to the list of office holders to whom the Chief Inspector may delegate his functions in paragraph 7(2) of Schedule 8 to the 2002 Act.

entry.title: The Criminal Justice (Sentencing) (Licence Conditions) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order sets out the standard and other conditions that may be imposed when a prisoner is released from prison on licence into the community under sections 250 and 251 of the Criminal Justice Act 2003 (c. 44). Article 2 contains the standard conditions, which apply in the case of all prisoners released on licence, and cover matters such as residence, work and travel requirements. Article 3 sets out other conditions that may be imposed in the case of all prisoners serving a determinate prison sentence of 12 months or more, and for the purpose of public protection only in the case of prisoners serving a sentence of less than 12 months. Examples of this type of condition are a requirement not to approach or contact a particular person, or enter a particular place. Article 4 contains an additional condition, available only in the case of prisoners serving a determinate prison sentence of 12 months or more, requiring the prisoner to participate in a specified activity or set of activities. An example of this would be a condition that the prisoner attended a particular offending behaviour programme.

entry.title: The European Parliamentary Elections (Returning Officers) Order 2003
entry.summary: Article 2 revokes the previous Order which appointed returning officers for the electoral regions. Article 3 of, and the Schedule to, the Order designate returning officers at European Parliamentary elections for electoral regions in England, other than London. The returning officer for London is to be appointed separately. Articles 4 and 5 designate the returning officer for such elections for the electoral regions of Scotland and Wales.

entry.title: The Homelessness (Suitability of Accommodation) (England) Order 2003
entry.summary: When discharging a housing function to secure that accommodation is available for an applicant who is homeless, or threatened with homelessness, under Part 7 of the Housing Act 1996, a local housing authority must ensure that the accommodation is suitable (section 206(1)). The Homelessness (Suitability of Accommodation) Order 1996 (S.I. 1996/3204) specifies that in determining whether accommodation is suitable for a person, there shall be taken into account whether or not the accommodation is affordable for that person, and lists particular matters to be considered. This Order specifies the circumstances in which accommodation will not be regarded as suitable.

entry.title: The Producer Responsibility Obligations (Packaging Waste) Amendment (Scotland) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Producer Responsibility Obligations (Packaging Waste) Regulations 1997 (the “1997 Regulations”), which imposed on producers, and, on their behalf, scheme operators, obligations to recover and recycle specified tonnages of packaging waste, and related obligations, in order to attain the targets in Article 6(1) of Directive 94/62/EC (the “Directive”) (O.J. No. L 365, 31.12.94, p.10). A revision of the Directive which will set new targets to be met in 2008 is presently being negotiated and is expected to be agreed soon (see Com (2001) 729 final). In order to ensure that the absence of targets higher than those presently in the 1997 Regulations does not prejudice the United Kingdom’s ability to increase its rates of recovery and recycling sufficiently to meet the new Directive targets in 2008, these Regulations set interim domestic targets and recovery and recycling obligations which take account of the probable new targets which the United Kingdom is likely to have to meet in 2008.

entry.title: The Veterinary Surgeons and Veterinary Practitioners (Registration) Regulations Order of Council 2003
entry.summary: This Order approves the Veterinary Surgeons and Veterinary Practitioners (Registration) Regulations 2003 (“the Regulations”), made by the Royal Council of Veterinary Surgeons (“the RCVS”) under section 11 of the Veterinary Surgeons Act 1966 (c. 36). It comes into force on 1 April 2004.

entry.title: The Extradition Act 2003 (Police Powers: Codes of Practice) Order 2003

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: Extradition Act 2003 (Police Powers: Codes of Practice) Order 2003

entry.summary: This Order brings into operation, on 1st January 2004, the codes of practice made pursuant to section 173 of the Extradition Act 2003 (“the Act”) in connection with the exercise by police officers and customs officers of the powers conferred by Part 4 of the Act.

entry.title: The Extradition Act 2003 (Commencement and Savings) (Amendment No. 2) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order amends the Extradition Act 2003 (Commencement and Savings) Order 2003, by replacing article 3 of that Order. Article 2(2) substitutes a new article 3 which makes it clear that the Extradition Act 2003 shall not come into force for any request for extradition made under the existing legislation.

entry.title: Air Quality (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Air Quality Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 in order to correct a drafting error. The air quality objective for Sulphur dioxide is increased from 35μg/m3 to 350μg/m3.

entry.title: The Extradition Act 2003 (Part 3 Designation) Order 2003
entry.summary: Part 3 of the Extradition Act 2003 sets out the procedures for making outgoing extradition requests from the United Kingdom. A Part 3 warrant is an extradition request made to a category 1 territory. Section 142 allows a judge to issue a Part 3 warrant on application by a constable or an appropriate person. Article 2 specifies descriptions of persons who are “appropriate persons” for these purposes.

entry.title: The Extradition Act 2003 (Designation of Part 1 Territories) Order 2003
entry.summary: Part 1 of the Extradition Act 2003 introduces new extradition procedures. These procedures include a new statutory appeal process and a reduced involvement of the Secretary of State. Article 2 designates those territories with which the United Kingdom will be operating the new extradition procedures.

entry.title: The Tax Credits (Provision of Information) (Evaluation and Statistical Studies) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: Paragraph 4 of Schedule 5 to the Tax Credits Act 2002 (c. 21) enables information relating to tax credits, child benefit or guardian’s allowance to be provided by the Board of Inland Revenue to the Secretary of State for purposes relating to evaluation or statistical studies as may be prescribed. These regulations prescribe such purposes.

entry.title: The Local Government Best Value (Exemption) (England) Order 2003

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: The Local Government Best Value (Exemption) (England) Order 2003

entry.summary: This Order revokes and replaces the Local Government Best Value (Exemption) (England) Order 2000. The effect of this Order is that all parish councils, except those whose budgeted income for each of the financial years beginning in 1997, 1998 and 1999 was more than £500,000, are exempted from the best value duties in Part 1 of the Local Government Act 1999.

entry.title: The Water Environment and Water Services (Scotland) Act 2003 (Designation of Scotland River Basin District) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order designates a river basin district as required by section 4(1) of the Water Environment and Water Services (Scotland) Act 2003.

entry.title: The Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) (Amendment) (No. 5) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: These Regulations further amend the Motor Vehicles (Driving Licences) Regulations 1999 (S.I. 1999/2864; “the principal Regulations”) by the inclusion of a requirement for a candidate undertaking a unitary test for a licence to drive vehicles in vehicle category F, G, H or K to be able to demonstrate on one occasion, and describe on another, a safety check on a component of the vehicle being of a class in respect of which he is seeking a licence.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty Land Tax (Amendment of Schedule 4 to the Finance Act 2003) Regulations 2003
entry.summary: Section 55(1) of the Finance Act 2003 (c. 14) provides that the amount of stamp duty land tax chargeable is by reference to the chargeable consideration for a land transaction. Section 50(2) confers power on the Treasury to amend Part 4 of that Act relating to chargeable consideration. Schedule 4 to the Act provides for the determination of chargeable consideration. These Regulations amend Schedule 4 in its application to arrangements involving public or educational bodies.

entry.title: The Extradition Act 2003 (Designation of Part 2 Territories) Order 2003

ukm:Supersedes.dc:title: Extradition Act 2003 (Designation of Part 2 Territories) Order 2003

entry.summary: Part 2 of the Extradition Act 2003 (“the Act”) applies to all territories with which the United Kingdom has extradition relations that are not designated as category 1 territories. Article 2 designates those territories which will be category 2 territories and for which the provisions of Part 2 of the Act will apply.

entry.title: Designation of Schools Having a Religious Character (Independent Schools) (England) (No.3) Order 2003
entry.summary: This Order designates the independent schools named herein as having a religious character.
